revised_title: Vitality and Virulence of Bacillus Anthracis in Potable Waters
tldr: This article investigates the vitality and virulence of Bacillus anthracis, a pathogenic bacterium, in potable waters. The authors found that anthrax spores can survive in various types of water for long periods, posing a risk to public health. They also discovered that the multiplication of the bacteria depends on the water's chemical composition and that the power of propagation in sterile water is limited.
